intro: Mattiastrum turcomanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan starwort, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in the spring. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Mattiastrum turcomanicum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
